metadata.title: CVE-2023-52631 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:fs/ntfs3: Fix an NULL dereference bug The issue here is when this is calledfrom ntfs_load_attr_list(). The "size" comes fromle32_to_cpu(attr->res.data_size) so it can't overflow on a 64bit systemsbut on 32bit systems the "+ 1023" can overflow and the result is zero. Thismeans that the kmalloc will succeed by returning the ZERO_SIZE_PTR and thenthe memcpy() will crash with an Oops on the next line.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52631` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1006-aws - 6.8.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-ibm - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-25-lowlatency - 6.8.0-25.25.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-25-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-25.25.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-oracle - 6.8.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1004-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
